--- In unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com, "jszyma9302" <jszyma9302@...> wrote:
>
> Hello, my name is Lisa and after reading an article my friend wrote, my husband Jim and I realized we are unschoolers! We have 2 children our son Riley just turned 10 and our daughter Hanna is 6. We live in Florida and have been homeschooling the kids for 4 years. We have tried to fit in to all the wrong co ops and such and now,we are out to learn about unschooling.
> Can anyone please tell me where to go to find what I need to do in Florida regarding registering as unschoolers? Thanks in dvance and I look forward to meeting you all!
>

messages.subject: Re: Hi, we are new
messages.msgSnippet: For FL, whether you currently have your Home Education Program registered with your county or you have your children enrolled in an umbrella school, there is
messages.messageBody:
For FL, whether you currently have your Home Education Program registered with your county or you have your children enrolled in an umbrella school, there is nothing different, legally, that you need to do in order to live as unschoolers.

If you have the annual evaluations under the county method, you will need to find an evaluator who gets unschooling.

If you are using the umbrella option, you need to find one that fits with unschooling.

Write me off-list if you want more info.

Nance Confer
marbleface@...

messages.subject: Re:Hi, we are new
messages.msgSnippet: Unschooling is legally the same as homeschooling so whatever you ve been doing, that s not changing. --Deb R
messages.messageBody:
Unschooling is legally the same as homeschooling so whatever you've been
doing, that's not changing.



--Deb R

messages.subject: Re: Hi, we are new
messages.msgSnippet: Hi Lisa, Nance Confer and I have unschooled in Florida for oh, 15 years or so and gradually slogged through all the legal options, misinformation from the
messages.messageBody:
Hi Lisa,

Nance Confer and I have unschooled in Florida for oh, 15 years or so and gradually slogged through all the legal options, misinformation from the state association, DOE and homeschool email lists, etc. She's on this list too and probably will answer, but feel free to write me offlist ant time, just click reply here and then change the pull-down menu at "To:" so it comes to me directly and not the whole list. I'm in Tallahassee and Nance is near Indian River or somewhere south -- glad to meet you, JJ

messages.subject: Hi, we are new
messages.msgSnippet: Hello, my name is Lisa and after reading an article my friend wrote, my husband Jim and I realized we are unschoolers! We have 2 children our son Riley just
messages.messageBody:
Hello, my name is Lisa and after reading an article my friend wrote, my husband Jim and I realized we are unschoolers! We have 2 children our son Riley just turned 10 and our daughter Hanna is 6. We live in Florida and have been homeschooling the kids for 4 years. We have tried to fit in to all the wrong co ops and such and now,we are out to learn about unschooling.
Can anyone please tell me where to go to find what I need to do in Florida regarding registering as unschoolers? Thanks in dvance and I look forward to meeting you all!
